description: AccuWeather provides hourly and Minute by Minute™ forecasts with Superior Accuracy™ for any longitude/latitude on Earth, with customized content and engaging video presentations available on smart phones, tablets, free wired and mobile Internet sites, connected TVs, and Internet appliances, as well as via radio, television, and newspapers.

blocks.name: listAdminAreas
blocks.description: Returns basic information about administrative areas in the specified country.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API key

args.name: countryCode
args.info: Country code

args.name: language
args.info: String indicating the language in which to return the resource

args.name: offset
args.info: Integer, along with the limit (25) that determines the first resource to be returned.

blocks.name: listCountries
blocks.description: Returns basic information about all countries within a specified region.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API key

args.name: regionCode
args.info: Region code

args.name: language
args.info: String indicating the language in which to return the resource

args.info: Your API key

args.name: language
args.info: String indicating the language in which to return the resource

blocks.name: listTopCities
blocks.description: Returns information for the top 50, 100, or 150 cities, worldwide.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API key

args.name: group
args.info: Integer value (50, 100, or 150) that specifies the number of cities to return

args.name: language
args.info: String indicating the language in which to return the resource

args.name: details
args.info: Boolean value (true or false) that specifies whether or not to include a truncated version of the current conditions object or the full object

blocks.name: searchLocations

args.info: Your API key

args.info: Text to search for.

args.name: language
args.info: String indicating the language in which to return the resource

blocks.name: searchCity
blocks.description: Returns information for an array of cities that match the search text.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API key

args.name: query
args.info: Text to search for.

args.name: language
args.info: String indicating the language in which to return the resource

args.name: details
args.info: Boolean value (true or false) that specifies whether or not to include a truncated version of the current conditions object or the full object

args.name: offset
args.info: Integer, along with the limit (25) that determines the first resource to be returned.

args.name: alias
args.info: Enumeration that specifies when alias locations should be included in the results. By default, an alias will only be returned if no official match for the search text was found. Enumeration values: Never or Always

blocks.name: searchByGeoposition
blocks.description: Returns information about a specific location, by GeoPosition (Latitude and Longitude).

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Your API key

args.name: coordinates
args.info: Text to search for. In this case, the text should be a comma-separated lat/lon pair (lat,lon).

args.name: language
args.info: String indicating the language in which to return the resource

args.name: details
args.info: Boolean value (true or false) that specifies whether or not to include a truncated version of the current conditions object or the full object

args.name: toplevel
args.info: When toplevel=true, the city with the highest rank will be returned. Large cities have higher rank than the neighborhoods within them, so toplevel=true delivers a more generic location result. (Example: 40.73,-74.00 returns Greenwich Village, NY when toplevel=false. If toplevel=true, the same lat/lon pair will return New York, NY.)

args.name: ipAddress

args.name: language

args.name: details
args.info: Boolean value (true or false) that specifies whether or not to include a truncated version of the current conditions object or the full object
